info.name: VeendHQ Wallet System
info.description:
**Staging URL**: `https://test.veendhq.com`

## Authentication

To use this API,

1. All API calls must have a x-tag header. You need to get an x-tag value by calling the get x-tag endpoint under the Initialize section. x-tags can be reused
2. All API call needs to be authenticated. You need to call the Login endpoint under Users section with your email/phonenumber and password. This will return a jwt token. Pass the jwt token value in the header as an `Authorization` header, with the value `Bearer 'The JWT Token Value'`. eg `Authorisation: Bearer ghjkjhgfghsyytyjsd`.
3. Every request made to the API automatically generates a `requestId`. It is available in the Header `X-Request-Id`. Save this in your DB for audit reasons

request.description:
Registers a new user,

Basic Payload

`phonenumber, password, currency, email, referralCode,type ,firstName ,lastName`

In addition to this, add the following according to account type.

For Personal/Employee Account  
`bvn, nin, idFile, idType, dateOfBirth ,gender`

For Company Account

`bvn, directorBvn gender, nin, businessName, businessAddress, businessPhoneNumber, businessEmail, directorDob,businessCountry,cacFile, statusFile ,addressState, accountPurpose, employeeSize, natureOfBusiness`

** Note:

- For company, bvn is the contact person bvn while directorBvn is that of the director
- idType is an enum value nin |voters_card | passport
- idFile is a url to the id image
- cacFile is a url to the cac doc
- statusFIle is a url to business status report or form7 file
Starts the password reset process by sending a password reset link or sms
Verifies the users email or phone number after sign up
Log in a user and returns a jwt token
Set the password of a user. This is the last step for reseting a password or team invitation.

request.description: Returns a list of supported banks

item.name: Payment Links

request.description:
This endpoint enables users to create a payment link associated with a specific account. Upon creation, the payment link can be shared with customers to facilitate payments for products or services. A slug is returned in the response which is unique.

A payment link can be constructed using the format **`{{url}}/p/{{slug}}`**

**URL**: On sandbox, use `test.veendhq.com` while on production, use `pay.veendhq.com` E.g [https://pay.veendhq.com/p/JW1cCbfq](https://pay.veendhq.com/p/JW1cCbfqTN)

To create payment link:

- `name`, `description`, `currency` and `amount` are required fields
- `type` defaults to **oneTime** if not passed, currently supports only **oneTime** but the acceptable types are **oneTime** and **recurring**
- `amount` entered should be between **100** and **10 million** NGN
- `additionalInfoToCollect` is an optional field that should be an _array of comma-separated strings_
- `image` is optional and should be the url to the image
- `channels` defaults to **\[card, bank-transfer\]** if not passed. Acceptable channels currently are card and bank-transfer. If both are selected, it means users can pay using their card through the link using the provider we support and can pay using the account number generated for the transaction
- `webhookUrl` is optional, defines the url to receive the callback
- `reference` is optional and should be unique if passed, this is sent back as part of the data in the callback

item.description: The **Payment Link API** allows users to create payment links that facilitate receiving money through card or bank transfer. These links are associated with specific accounts and enable seamless transactions, with funds settled directly into the linked account.
